subject: AI & Agents
title: How AI Sees Images
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How AI Sees Images.

hook.text: You see a golden retriever. A computer sees 786,432 numbers arranged in a grid.

buildup.text: Images are grids of pixels. Each pixel is just a color value â€” red, green, blue.

discovery.text: Convolutional neural networks scan small patches, detecting edges, then shapes, then objects.

twist.text: Change one pixel by a tiny amount and the model might call a panda a gibbon.

climax.text: AI vision now outperforms humans at reading X-rays, but it still trips on optical illusions.
